notes: Second generation rebadged Toyota bB (2007-2015). Larger than first generation. Discontinued after 2015 due to declining sales. Data sourced from Wikipedia Scion xB article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation sports coupe (2010-2016). Reintroduced as Toyota 86 after Scion discontinued. Panoramic sunroof standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Scion tC article, January 2025 revision.
Rebadged Toyota ist second generation (2007-2014). Replaced xA. Discontinued 2014. Data sourced from Wikipedia Scion xD article, January 2025 revision.
Rebadged Toyota iQ (2011-2015). Ultra-compact city car. Poor sales led to early discontinuation. Data sourced from Wikipedia Scion iQ article, January 2025 revision.

Joint development with Subaru (2012-2016). Subaru BRZ twin. Boxer engine, rear-wheel drive. Became Toyota 86 after Scion discontinued. Popular enthusiast car. Data sourced from Wikipedia Scion FR-S article, January 2025 revision.
